intro: Meniscium reticulatum var. serratum, commonly known as the serrated nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs and can cause skin irritation upon contact.
